definition: can/to be able to/might possibly/ability/(physics) energy

sentences.english: Meanwhile, it mostly desorbed methylic alcohol within a given time.

sentences.english: Speed work burns a great amount of calories in a short period of time.

sentences.english: You told me that you'd be here in 10 minutes.
sentences.chinese: 你還說十分鐘內能到達的。

sentences.english: But how far can debt collectors legally go?
sentences.chinese: 但是追債人在法律範圍內能做的多大限度呢？

sentences.english: Men may promise more in a day than they will fulfill in a year.

sentences.chinese: 這說明平衡狀態下內能u是最小的。

sentences.english: So for an ideal gas, we saw that u was only a function of temperature.
sentences.chinese: 對於理想氣體，我們知道內能只是溫度的函數。

sentences.english: Sure, it will increase sales for a period of time.
sentences.chinese: 當然，在一段時間內能提高銷售量。

sentences.english: TS A is u minus TS.

definition: turning point/breaking point/inflexion point (math., a point of a curve at which the curvature changes sign)
to march straight in unchallenged (military) (idiom)/(fig.) to push deep into the heart of sth/to flood in
